result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Rafael Plumey

records.addlTxt: Upon motion of State, Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for  plea/sentencing hearing,     Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  
AS TO COUNT 1  is dismissed but read-in for the purposes of sentencing in 22CF000354.
Victim impact statement received and filed
Restitution request form received and filed

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Lamke is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty Matthew Lamke received and files

Court ordered no contact with Catherine P.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
